newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia c. bank puts temporary admin on big bank.
newsitem.headline: Russia c. bank puts temporary admin on big bank.

text.p: The central bank imposed on Wendnesday a temporary administration on Kredobank, Russia's 32nd biggest bank by assets, a central bank official said.
The official said that the administration was imposed because of the bank's long-term inability to meet its obligations, including a growing debt to the State Customs Committee.
He did not say whether the State Customs Committee accounts would remain with Kredobank, or transferred to another bank.
On June 1 1996 Kredobank's assets amounted to 2.30 trillion roubles, according to Rating Agency data.
Kredobank is the seventh Russian bank to be subjected to temporary administration central bank.
The central bank is tightening its grip on Russia's ailing banking sector, withdrawing licences from a handful of small and medium-sized banks every month.
On Tuesday a central bank official said the bank was considering withdrawing licences from 130 banks, adding that a further 200 banks had liabilities higher than assets.
